sentences.cn: 不要把礼貌不放在心上.

sentences.en: I don't mean to disparage your achievements.
sentences.cn: 我并不想贬低你的成就。

sentences.en: I'm not saying this to disparage kids.
sentences.cn: 我这么说并非和孩子们过不去.

sentences.en: In the domains of letters, it is notoriously known that writers tend to disparage each other.
sentences.cn: 在文学界,文人相轻是人所共知 、 臭名在外的.

sentences.en: Matcham’s theatres were widely disparaged by architects.
sentences.cn: 马彻姆设计的剧院遭到了建筑师的普遍抨击。

sentences.en: Never disparage yourself or minimize your strength or power.
sentences.cn: 不要贬低你自己或降低你的力量或能力.

sentences.en: One disparage the greatness that insults.
sentences.cn: 而他只得贬低这一感到侮辱的伟大.

sentences.en: Researchers must not unjustifiably criticise or disparage other Researchers.
sentences.cn: 研究人员不能不公正地批评或贬损其他研究人员.

sentences.en: Those who disparage Brutus are talking of his shadow.
sentences.cn: 那些批评布鲁塔士的人谈的是他的影子.

sentences.en: V : Now, now. Do not disparage the noble hexagon.
sentences.cn: 现在, 来. 别轻视了华贵的六边形.

sentences.en: We rightly disparage Job's three friends for their insensitive response to his suffering.
sentences.cn: 对于约伯的痛苦,三个朋友愚钝的回应常备受批评.

sentences.en: With that said Hung - chien could no longer disparage him.
sentences.cn: 这样一说,鸿 渐 倒没法损他了.

sentences.en: You should not disparage good manners.
sentences.cn: 你不应该轻视好的风度.

sentences.en: Your behaviour will disparage the whole family.
sentences.cn: 你的行为将使全家丢脸.

words.tran_cn: 以轻视的态度，蔑视地；以贬抑的口吻

trans.tran_cn: 蔑视, 贬损, 使失去信誉
trans.tran_en: to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not think they are very good or important
to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not think they are very good or important
